intro: Lasiandra stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruited lasiandra, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, pinkish-white inflorescences. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to reduce water loss in arid conditions. Lasiandra stenocarpa is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
